name: AWS Lambda Environment Variables not encrypted at-rest using CMK
description:
When you create or update Lambda functions that use environment variables, AWS Lambda encrypts them using the AWS Key Management Service. When your Lambda function is invoked, those values are decrypted and made available to the Lambda code.

This policy verifies that Lambda function uses the AMS Key Management Service to encrypt variables at-rest with CMK.
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'aws' AND api.name = 'aws-lambda-list-functions' AND json.rule = environment.variables exists and kmskeyArn does not exist
recommendation:
To enable Lambda Environment Variable at-rest encryption using CMK, follow below mentioned URL:
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lambda/latest/dg/configuration-envvars.html#configuration-envvars-encryption 
Securing environment variables section
compliance.standard: CyberSecurity Law of the People's Republic of China
